history.content:
SP21 Statistics Course Planning Workshop 10/13

After the success of SUSA's course planning workshop last semester, SUSA will be holding another course planning workshop on Tuesday, October 13 from 6:30 - 7:30 PM PDT for the upcoming Phase I registration!
Do you know what you’re taking next semester? What about the semester after that? The semester after that? Don’t look back during your senior year and wish you had taken that one essential prerequisite; come to SUSA’s course planning workshop! Learn about the major, upcoming requirements and course changes(there are several), and how to apply to grad classes!
Register here: https://berkeley.zoom.us/meeting/register/tJAvduqtrzksGNIeTMnMjHpZw7rfnXqPNyP_ to receive your Zoom link.

Facebook Event: https://www.facebook.com/events/779783752786398/

Statistics Graduate-Undergraduate Program


Introducing the Statistics Graduate-Undergraduate Program (SGUP)!

Mentorship:

If you're an undergrad considering grad school in Statistics or Biostatistics or feel like the statistics major lacks community, the grad students in Berkeley's Statistics Department want to mentor you! The Statistics Graduate Student Association (SGSA), in partnership with SUSA, is launching the Statistics Graduate/Undergraduate Program, where undergraduate students will have the opportunity to form a close personal and professional relationship with a statistics or biostatistics Phd or Master’s student. 
Applications to be matched with a mentor due Thursday, October 15, 11:59 PM PDT:  https://susa.berkeley.edu/sgup/apply

Office Hours:

Undergraduates unable to commit to a semester long program may attend SGUP’s weekly office hours, open to the entire undergraduate community, where graduate student mentors will be available to chat and answer questions about graduate school and all things statistics. 


For more general information about SGUP, visit https://susa.berkeley.edu/sgup
history.subject: [SUSA] Statistics Course Planning Workshop 10/13 and Mentorship Opportunity
